You are right-if you have to do too much enhancing to hear something, then =
you just can't call it EVP.

But that really doesn't mean that there isn't =
anything there, because there could be, but it isn't good enough to be cons=
idered.

You can tweak and play with a recording as long as you want, so lo=
ng as you always keep the original in pristine condition for comparison. Wh=
en I go to process my audio, upon opening the track, I immediately save it =
to another name so that I am sure not to accidentally save over the origina=
l.

If you have tweaked the audio to the point that it is completely unreco=
gnizable from the original, I would say that may be too far.

"Are we just =
making ourselves believe there is something there??"

Unfortunately I think=
 alot of the times we are. It is called pareidolia, or matrixing. It is a n=
atural functioning of our brains to pick out familiar patterns out of rando=
mness. Like faces in the clouds and sounds in white noise. This make our jo=
b of deciphering what is authentic EVP and what is just matrixing very diff=
icult. You can't even trust yourself entirely.

Now before Frank kicks my b=
utt on that, I need to state the disclaimer that this is only if we wish ou=
r evidence to stand up to scientific scrutiny. I do know that there is some=
 value to gut feelings, but gut feelings won't get you anywhere in the scie=
ntific world.

April

  From: Eric VanDuze=
r 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Monday, May 18, 2009 7:11 AM
  Su=
bject: [EVP-ITC] I have a question.





  Now I may be biased to the "inve=
stigation" way of doing things.  I do clean up evps if I hear something and=
 can't make it out do to ambient noise.  So hear is my question.  When do y=
ou stop cleaning up?  Wouldn't to much enhancing "taint" the results?  To m=
e the more enhancing you do the less convincing it becomes.  I hope noone f=
inds this offensive, it is not meant to be I am just really curious.  The w=
ay I look at it is that if you have to do so much enhancing to find anythin=
g, was there really something there to begin with.  Are we just making ours=
elves believe there is something there??

  Eric
